word_mean: 免疫力：通过免疫接种或因过去罹患某病产生免疫反应，或由于其他非免疫性因素，致使产生对某传染病的抵抗力
机体免疫系统对一切异物或抗原性物质进行非特异或特异性识别和排斥清除的一种生理学功能。
在传输过程中，接收机或终端设备减少或排除干扰对其有用信号影响的能力。

sentence.Network_en: The embassy official claimed diplomatic immunity and was later released.
sentence.Network_cn: 那名使馆官员申请外交豁免，随后被释放。

sentence.Network_en: Because of the immunity of the immature insects, it'simportant to spray regularly.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于幼虫对药物有免疫力，因此必须经常喷药。

sentence.Network_en: The police are offering immunity to witnesses.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方对证人将免予起诉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: in the sense 'exemption (from a liability'): from Latin immunitas, from immunis (see immune)

entry.def: If you are immune to a particular disease, you cannot be affected by it.

example.ex: This blood test will show whether or not you're immune to the disease...
example.tran: 这个血检会显示你是否对这种疾病具有免疫力。

example.ex: Most adults are immune to Rubella.
example.tran: 大多数成人对风疹具有免疫力。

entry.def: An immune response or reaction is a reaction by the body's immune system to something harmful that is affecting it.

example.ex: It is hoped the procedure will trigger an immune response that will wipe out HIV-infected cells while leaving non-infected cells unharmed.
example.tran: 希望这一治疗会激发免疫反应,清除感染了艾滋病病毒的细胞，同时又不损伤未感染细胞。

entry.def: If you are immune to something that happens or is done, you are not affected by it.

example.ex: Whilst Marc did gradually harden himself to the poverty, he did not become immune to the sight of death...
example.tran: 尽管马克逐渐对贫困现象无动于衷,但他对于死亡的惨象还是不免动容。

example.ex: Football is not immune to economic recession.
example.tran: 足球不可能不受到经济衰退的影响。

entry.def: Someone or something that is immune from a particular process or situation is able to escape it.

example.ex: Members of the Bundestag are immune from prosecution for corruption...
example.tran: 德国联邦议院的成员可免受贪腐罪的起诉。

example.ex: No one is immune from scandal.

means.word_mean: 1. the state of not being susceptible;
2. (medicine) the condition in which an organism can resist disease
3. the quality of being unaffected by something;

auth_sentence.content: It also has a role in immunity and healing.
auth_sentence.res_content: It also has a role in immunity and healing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It also has a role in immunity and healing.

auth_sentence.content: It would not grant Mr Sollecito immunity from extradition.
auth_sentence.res_content: It would not grant Mr Sollecito immunity from extradition.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It would not grant Mr Sollecito immunity from extradition.

auth_sentence.content: For them, herd immunity is the only defense.
auth_sentence.res_content: For them, herd immunity is the only defense.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For them, herd immunity is the only defense.

stems_affixes.type_exp: = 表示"服务,职责,社区,公共"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 普通的,寻常的;共有的,公共的
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+mon=mun公共→共有的,公共的
com共同+mun社区+e→共同的社区→公社,引申为交流
im不+mun公共+ity表名词→不公共→不和别人一样[得病]→免疫

stems_affixes.value_cn: 交换思想,意见或感受,交流
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+mun社区+e→共同的社区→公社,引申为交流
im不+mun公共+ize表动词→使不公共→使不和别人一样[得病]→使免疫

Sentence.sentence: It enhances immunity to certain diseases.

sentences.en: They respected diplomatic immunity as valid.
sentences.cn: 他们承认外交豁免权有效。

sentences.en: A strong immunity to reinfection develops after one year.
sentences.cn: 一年后能对再度感染产生强大免疫力。

sentences.en: High levels of stress may lower your immunity to common illnesses.
sentences.cn: 压力过大可能会使你对常见疾病的免疫力下降。

sentences.en: Once you have had a cold you build up immunity to that particular virus.
sentences.cn: 你一旦患上感冒，你的身体就会产生对付那种病毒的免疫力。
